title: Modeling a Periodic Context - Electric Fan Part B

content.description:
The blades of an electric fan rotate in a clockwise direction and complete \(5\) rotations every second. Point \(B\) is on the tip of one of the fan blades and is located directly above the center of the fan at time <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIWaaaaa@3902@</annotation> </semantics> </math> seconds, as indicated in the figure. Point \(B\) is \(6\) inches from the center of the fan. The center of the fan is \(20\) inches above a level table on which the fan sits. As the fan blades rotate at a constant speed, the distance between \(B\) and the surface of the table periodically decreases and increases.

The sinusoidal function \(h\) models the distance between \(B\) and the surface of the table, in inches, as a function of time \(t\), in seconds.
content.question:
Part B

The function \(h\) can be written in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4804@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find values of constants \(a\), \(b\), \(c\), and \(d\).

frqParts.text:
Part B

The function \(h\) can be written in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4804@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find values of constants \(a\), \(b\), \(c\), and \(d\).

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
